results.title: For the love of dance
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael McKennirey, John Smith, Adam Symansky, David Wilson, Cynthia Scott/Canada Council and Cynthia Scott
results.brief_description: A backstage look at Canada’s burgeoning dance industry, with seven of the country’s top professional dance companies. Filmed on location across North America, this documentary records the exacting daily grind of whistle-stop tours, exhausting repetitive practice, and little rest. Colourful excerpts highlight each troupe’s unique repertoire, as dancers give dazzling displays of physical control and grace. It is a moving tribute to the thousands of dancers who strive for perfection every day. Narrated by Adrienne Clarkson. (Awards: New York; Ronda-Malaga) N.B. Two minutes of footage is missing from the beginning of this film.

results.title: For the love of Benji
results.creator_credit: Mulberry Square, Ben Vaughn and Joe Camp
results.brief_description: In this sequel to the popular family movie “Benji”, our furry friend is in store for more heart stopping adventures. When holidaying in Greece with ladyfriend Tiffany and his newly adopted family, Benji and his friend are off to a bad start when they become embroiled in an international spy ring. Starring Cynthia Smith, Allen Fiuzat, Patsy Garrett and Ed Nelson.

results.title: For the love of a horse
results.brief_description: Follows the training and competition events of a 13 year-old girl and her horse as they prepare for equestrian trials. The girl’s trainer is Jim Elder, Canada’s Olympic gold medal winner, who explains the correct and incorrect procedures for equestrian riding. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Nomad Films International and Douglas Stanley
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing how birth by the natural method can be a beautiful experience in communication and togetherness for the whole family. It illustrates the need for proper mental and physical preparation.

results.title: For science and the arts
results.brief_description: A rare distinction for outstanding achievements in science or art is selection to the exclusive German Order “Pour le Merite”, limited to 30 German and 30 foreign artists and scientists. Shows distinguished members and outstanding scientific and artistic achievements of the 19th and 20th centuries. In English and German language.

results.title: For peace of mind
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services, Tanglefoot Productions, Film Victoria, Hilary Christmas and Fiona Banks
results.brief_description: A creative video set in rural Victoria, which revolves around two friends, Maureen and Fay, and Maureen’s daughter Di. The program targets women over 50, promotes the benefits of having a Pap Smear on a regular basis and deals with the barriers women face to having them. The storyline is interwoven with professional opinions from experts and practitioners in women’s health, and reveals commonly held attitudes to the subject by women in this age group.

results.title: For me and my gal
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Busby Berkeley
results.brief_description: Two of MGM’s brightest stars, Gene Kelly in his film debuty and Judy Garland, teamed in this Busby Berkeley musical about a vaudeville song-and-dance duo who buck tough times and World War I on the way to showbusiness success. The film has a collection of nostalgic gems including “Smiles”, “Ballin’ the Jack” and the title tune. Kelly’s inimitable dance style shines and Garland sustains her position as one of the greatest Hollywood legends. Bursting with energy, this is an old-fashioned musical for everyone who loves the movies.
